subject: Home & DIY
title: How Tankless Water Heaters Work
description: A quick win: understand How Tankless Water Heaters Work.

hook.text: Old water heaters keep 200 liters hot around the clock, even while you sleep. Tankless units fire only on demand.

buildup.text: A flow sensor detects water moving. Gas burners or electric coils ignite instantly, heating water on the fly.

discovery.text: Because there's no standby loss, tankless units use 24-34% less energy than conventional tank heaters.

twist.text: The catch: they have a maximum flow rate. Running two showers and a dishwasher simultaneously can overwhelm the unit.

climax.text: Tankless heaters last 20+ years versus 10-15 for tanks. Higher upfront cost, but lower lifetime expense.

punchline.text: Heat water only when you need it. Simple.

quiz.question: What triggers a tankless water heater to start heating?
options: A flow sensor detecting water movement
A timer set to your daily schedule
The water temperature dropping below a set point
